item.title: Beogram 4002 (5513): Repair of a Missing Leaf Spring on a Plate Lock
item.description:
During the rebuild of a Beogram 4002 (5513), I encountered an issue while adjusting the sub-chassis, platter, and tonearm. The large aluminum plate wasn’t sitting correctly against the plinth when it was pushed back, making it impossible to align the platter flush with the plate. The problem originated from one of the locking mechanisms in the back left corner. These locks, equipped with leaf springs, are designed to secure the plate to the frame when the plinth is moved back...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4002-5513-repair-of-a-missing-leaf-spring-on-a-plate-lock/

item.title: Selecting the appropriate tea for the workplace break room
item.description:
It’s common to find pre-mixed tea sachets or teabags in office pantries. While these are convenient and widely available, Teabox, an online retailer specializing in premium Indian teas, suggests there might be downsides to these options. Source: Teabox website. Teabox CEO, Kaushal Dugar, explains that tea dust, a byproduct of tea production, lacks the full flavor, taste, and aroma of whole tea leaves. This tea dust is often what ends up in teabags, resulting in a less flavorful and potentially less nutritious cup...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/selecting-the-appropriate-tea-for-the-workplace-break-room/
